item.title: New Paper Published in Neural Computation
item.description: This paper studies a model animal choosing between different food sources in an ongoing decision-making process. The decision-making circuit regulating the response is implemented via a generic neural hardware motif. Nonlinearities in the circuit influence the behaviour of the model animal. We find the unexpected result that inherent oscillations of neuronal activity may enhance decision-making performance. Publication: T. Bose, A. Reina, J.A.R. Marshall, Neural Computation 31: 870-896 (2019)
